title: High Ping (without actually showing a high ping)
body: My ping shows a consistent 45 and it never jumps not even for a second, but the game acts like it's at about 150-200.  I move to where I clicked a good 1-2 seconds after I click there.  Occasionally my character will just stop and I can't move at all, I can click on things but nothing happens.  It's not an FPS issue

replies.body:
Hmmmmm this sounds an awful lot like packet loss. Basically that means that some of the data going between your network and our servers get lost before it makes it to us, which is causing that really high lag without seeing your ping spike. 

We should be able to know for sure by grabbing the game logs and throwing them into this [**log reader**](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/209765743). Take a screenshot using something like Gyazo and paste it here for us to go over together.

> [{quoted}](name=Broporo,realm=NA,application-id=osqw6G4M,discussion-id=aU6jK6Wb,comment-id=0000,timestamp=2017-06-04T00:22:50.815+0000)
>
> Hmmmmm this sounds an awful lot like packet loss. Basically that means that some of the data going between your network and our servers get lost before it makes it to us, which is causing that really high lag without seeing your ping spike. 
> 
> We should be able to know for sure by grabbing the game logs and throwing them into this [**log reader**](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/209765743). Take a screenshot using something like Gyazo and paste it here for us to go over together.

Ah I see.  I put the logs into that and it said I had high ping and high packet loss, my ping was average of about 45 with high of 49 and my packet loss was around 12%, but my ping has always been around 45, I don't consider that high.  As for packet loss, I put in a log of a game where I didn't have this weird lag and I only had a packet loss of around 2%, so that is the problem.  But I don't know how to increase it.  I've already tried everything it recommends.

Yeeeaaa I was just asking for a screenshot of the actual log reader image, but you did mention a 12% packet loss which would most likely be the source of those ping spikes. 

Most of the time, packet loss ends up being on the ISP side of things, but we might still be able to help out. Take the logs you uploaded to dropbox, and shoot them over to our tech guys in a [**ticket**](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/requests/new).

> [{quoted}](name=Broporo,realm=NA,application-id=osqw6G4M,discussion-id=aU6jK6Wb,comment-id=0000,timestamp=2017-06-04T00:22:50.815+0000)
>
> Hmmmmm this sounds an awful lot like packet loss. Basically that means that some of the data going between your network and our servers get lost before it makes it to us, which is causing that really high lag without seeing your ping spike. 
> 
> We should be able to know for sure by grabbing the game logs and throwing them into this [**log reader**](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/209765743). Take a screenshot using something like Gyazo and paste it here for us to go over together.

Could you tell me where to find the specific logs your looking for?  I don't need super specific directions but like when I go into the logs folder it has Game -R3d Logs, LeagueClient Logs, Maestro Logs, Network Logs, Patcher Logs, and Performance Logs.  All these folders have multiple log files in them too.

No worries! You'll be looking for Network Logs, and make sure to use the log of the game that had those ping spikes!

{{sticker:slayer-jinx-wink}}

That seemed like a lot of information to screenshot so I just put it in dropbox.  If you want it a different way though I guess I can screen shot it all.

https://www.dropbox.com/s/a0akq1lm4tmw3yp/league_log.txt?dl=0

That was just the last time it happened.  I have other logs of games that it happened in if you want to see those too.

Also, I just played a match and it didn't happen, but it has been happening the past week.  So I don't know why it would just do it some of the time but not every time.
